review: We loooooove junk food and we love McDonalds BUT, this specific location was a total frustration today. ξWe get there and there's about 4-5 people in the line before us and. by the time we order, maybe another 5-6 waiting BEHIND us. ξSo we place our order with Roberto, who is only in charge of the orders and the register, he will not do anything else. ξWe then proceed to wait for our food, we were hungry and in a rush so this was the easiest (and yes, unhealthy) option, or so we thought at the time. So we wait and wait and then wait some more and, in the meantime, the 5 people that came in AFTER us got their food and left...it's like HELLO!!!! WTF!!!! so hubby complains to Roberto who proceeds to explain that he only takes the order nothing else...duh! then Miguel, the manager, comes over, doesn't like the fact that hubby's obviously not happy with the situation and tells him it'll be another few minutes....w/e.Finally our food is ready and, guess what?!?!?!?!?! it was WRONG!!! WTF again!!! hubby goes back to the counter and now he is not nice at all and asks 'so how long will it take for me to get my correct order?' to which Miguel, the manager, turns around, gets hubby's correct order and exchanges it for the wrong one....HUH!?!?!?!?!?! amazing!!! By the time we get our food we are beyond hungry and in a not so nice mood. Oh well, at least I have to say that Miguel came to our table, when the rush was over to apologize for the incident and to offer us tomorrow's lunch for free, but we gratefully declined.

Food is always fresh however you always wait at least 15 minutes before you are served which is unacceptable for a fast food place. This place is good depending if you are looking for quality food, or quick turn around time. ξWish they had a drive through.
This location has the new strawberry creme pies. The healthscore is a 93 as of 3/26/12.The drive thru cashier was really nice, but my fries were far too crispy too be any good.

This is the worst McDonald's I have ever been to by far. I cannot think of enough bad things to say about their service.The Food is standard McDonald's fair, but, they did not give us our drinks with creamer, our order was wrong, the food oatmeal came without enough spoons for the orders count, we had to go back 3 times for all sorts of condiments, and they dish em out reservedly like their lives depend on it.They do not seem to understand foreign accents and this is Las Vegas, seriously, if you are going to run a shop in a tourist town, you might as well be prepared for it.

I've been a regular customer at McDonalds for some time now and recently moved to the Summerlin area. This sorry excuse for a McDonalds near my house has continued to have the worst customer service, wait time is horrible and by all means hope and pray they get your order right!!!! There is plenty of competition, I'd would be happy to take my business else where! McDonalds? What happen the the customer service and quick service?!!
Bum city ! Slow drive thru , slow employees, and dirty restrooms ! The Mcdonalds food is the same as always.
Kids playplace smells awful and there is food everywhere. ξWill never go there except the drive thru. ξDrive thru staff is very pleasant and polite, but it doesn't make up for the messy playplace.

The argument can be made that reviewing a McDonald's is a waste of everyone's time. ξThis McDonald's, however, warrants special mention. ξAlthough the place is reasonably clean and they generally get your order right, the length of time it takes for this to happen is genuinely baffling. ξNo matter what time of day you come in or how busy the place happens to be, it will always take far longer to complete your transaction than it reasonably should. ξIn light of the fact that speed is supposed to be the selling point of a McDonald's, I'd call this particular location a failure.

I'm not a huge fan of McDonalds in general, but I do eat at a McDonalds about once a month or so. ξThis McDonalds is one of the worst that I've been to. ξThe service inside was very slow. ξThe manager, who was helping run the cash register with another employee, kept allowing other people to jump in line and then looked at the rest of us with this look of..."You don't mind, do you?" ξWe decided to go through drive through instead hoping for faster service. ξWe got to the speaker and the employee asks "What do you want?" ξNot a "How can I help you" or anything semi-customer service oriented. ξWe decided to order anyway because my daughter was really excited for some fries. ξOtherwise we would have left at this point. ξWe placed our order and then pulled up to pay. ξShe told us one amount and then ended up giving me change for another amount. ξHowever, I didn't happen to check it until I had pulled up to the next window. ξWe pulled up to get our order at the 2nd window and the employee asked us what we had ordered. ξNot just an item or two so she could make sure we were the next order, but she wanted to know everything we had ordered. ξI'm not sure why there was an issue in relaying the information from the 1st window to the 2nd (especially with computers). ξThe 2nd window employee was nice and even wished us a good day. ξThe order was right and the fries were hot. ξUpon looking at the receipt, the cashier did give me the correct change she just said the wrong amount. ξWhen it comes to ordering, it really bothers me when you walk into a restaurant that has their breakfast menu up even though they say they are not serving breakfast anymore. ξInside the breakfast menu was up, but they told others they were not serving it anymore. ξIn the drive thru, we asked (just in case because I really wanted a sausage biscuit) but they said again they weren't serving breakfast. ξThe biggest problem with this was that because the breakfast menus were up the lunch menus were not and you would have had to know exactly what you wanted to get. ξWe ended up getting the basics: fries, hamburger, drink. ξ(I don't have the number meals memorized, and I swear they are different at each McDonalds.)Overall the service was slow and the employees were rude. ξIt was not busy during our visit. ξIt was 11am right before the lunch rush. ξI would avoid this McDonalds if you can.

With the amount of time it takes to get your order here, it's hard to call this 'fast food." Definitely, one of the worst run McDonald's I have ever seen. NO ONE wants to work. Between the lackadaisical cashiers to the employees just standing around instead of preparing food and filling drink orders, this place is a mess. Then add the dozens of homeless people in here and you really just want a shower when you get out. I say this, yet still go back at least twice a month (it's downstairs from my office and right off the 6 train, ok?) Another redeeming quality is the hash brown, which is perfectly cooked -- crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. ξWord of advice, listen very closely to the numbers when they call them out and steer clear of the bathrooms (don't even stand near them).

I was craving fast food - hadn't had it in weeks - so I decided to try this McDonald's on my lunch break. ξThe food sucked. ξThe nuggets had no taste. ξGrease was dripping from my fries. ξThe ice machine was out of ice. ξA homeless man was walking around the store begging for money. ξI think I'm going back to my non-Mcdonald's/non-fast food ways.
I just signed up for yelp. Rated this McDonald's a 1 star and wrote this review before I ever got my food. Slowest McDonald's in LA. 20 mintues waiting.

It's 2 for 1 review day! ξI can't review the Walmart without reviewing the McDonald's that resides inside. ξAnd boy is it some tantalizing stuff.I try not to give too many 1-star reviews but this McDonald's so deserves it. ξI hardly frequent a McDonald's at all (although this is my second McDonald's review in less than a week) but I need to let the peeps in on this one. ξNo Yelper should go unwarned. ξOf course I came to McDonald's since I have those coupons for their new contraption, the McWrap. ξWhich when I pronounce very fast and in my Scottish accent sounds much like 'McCrap'. ξAfter my second go round with this thing, I have made up my mind it is decidedly so. ξI need to write McDonald's execs to change the name on this thing immediately.My coupon for the day was buy a medium fries and a medium drink, get a McWrap of your choice for FREE. ξI have a hard time resisting free. ξI'm here to tell you...WORST ALMOST FREE MEAL OF MY LIFE!!! ξSeriously.It was the tail end of lunchtime so the line was still a bit busy. ξI patiently waited for almost 10 minutes...which is like forever in McDonald's time. ξAt least two folks left the line while I was there. ξI know it's not McDonald's fault, but the couple in front of me took up majority of the line space because they were in motorized wheelchairs. ξAnd they were very loud. ξThis doesn't bother me much. ξBut...they were also very stinky. ξYes, stinky. ξI have no problem with stinky in most cases (I occasionally help the homeless so I know) but the guy in front of me hadn't washed in DAYS if I were to guess. ξTo each his own, and I know it's almost summer so I know we all want to save water...but DAMN. ξIf I get a whiff and I have to take a step back? ξYou might be S-T-I-N-K-Y. ξBut who am I to judge? ξI took a big step back and waited my turn. ξFree is the motivation here. ξI finally get up there to the McDonald's cashier and present my coupon to the guy. ξHe takes a look at it and says 'We don't usually take the promo coupons at this location but we'll let you use it." ξThen he proceeds to put the coupon onto a stack of...more coupons! ξMind boggling to say the least. ξHe takes my order of a medium fries and medium drink, asks me what type of McWrap I want (Grilled Chicken & Bacon) and rings me up. ξ$2.91 later I'm given my receipt and asked to wait for my number to be called.I wait. ξAnd wait. ξ#1! ξ#2! ξ#3! ξ#5! ξ#6! ξ#7! ξ#8! ξObviously I'm #4 and 10 minutes later I am still waiting. ξHonestly, what the Hell are you guys doing back there? ξMixing the masa for my fresh pressed tortilla? ξFeathering a chicken? ξPerhaps ripening a tomato? ξI ask the McDonald's runner and he tells me, "We're waiting for your McWrap." ξOf course.At this point I'm almost running late to be back at work, so the minute I get my order I bolt back to the office and have lunch at my desk. ξThankfully I'm only three minutes away. ξI really, really should have just gone to the vending machine or eaten my stash of Reese's chocolate peanut butter eggs from last Easter. ξTalk about disappointment! ξI take out my McWrap from my bag and lay down the box of fries on my desk. ξI continue working while munching away on what is supposed to be McDonald's claim to fame. ξTheir golden fries. ξI bite into one, eh a bit stale. ξI bit into another one, eh not enough salt. ξI bite into yet another one, eh cold?? ξI look down, and whaddaya know? ξMy damn fry is not even barely cooked! ξWhite like Olivia Wilde in the winter. ξI look through the entire box and find at least half a dozen fries not cooked properly! ξNot golden brown! ξNot delicious! ξBarely out of their frozen state, and just limp. ξNot acceptable! ξPlease check my pic for proof of this travesty. ξMcDonald's not doing their fries right is like IKEA not serving their Swedish Meatballs with gravy. ξNO BUENO.After getting over this somewhat I finally hit my stride to go on to my Grilled Chicken & Bacon McWrap. ξWow, talk about lightning striking twice. ξThis thing was lifeless! ξAfter unwrapping this beast (the box is still the best part about this McWrap), I could just tell something was off. ξTortilla was already showing signs of being soggy way too long. ξThe chicken peeking out of the top was not looking tip top shape either. ξAfter some hesitation, I took a bite. ξUGH I say, UGH! ξFreshness was not part of the gameplan for this McDonald's today. ξAll cold and soggy! ξAnd upon all, my McWrap wasn't built correctly! ξInstead of having Spring Mix like it's supposed to, there was plain old shredded iceberg lettuce! ξAnd my bacon was missing! ξIn the words of our Lord Darth Vader....NOOOOOOOO! ξIt was McCrap through & through. ξTotally upset over this one. ξI have picture proof of this travesty of gourmet eats as well. ξMcDonald's you have pissed off the wrong fatty. ξI will definitely be calling your hotline to complain about this one for sure. ξKnowing my luck I'll get a coupon for a free McWrap. ξCRAP.
Bad service & no point of getting LARGE if they only fill up half the container -_-

You are in the drive thru at McD's...you aren't allowed to be angry that they got the order wrong. ξIT'S WHAT THEY DO. ξCheck the bag at the window. Always. ξAlways. ξMmmmmm fries and a shake. ξMe likey.

Its McDonald's so we already know the food is decent and slightly over priced. ξBut the staff here is bad. None of them speak english. They are slow. They will mess your order up so be sure to check it before leaving the drive thru.
Maybe it's just me, but it seems like the staff at this location isn't all that friendly.

Got into the drive thru line shortly after midnight on Saturday evening, so technically it was 2/15/15 Sunday. ξFive cars in line ahead of me. ξOrder took almost 30 minutes. ξIt was ridiculous. ξAnd instead of offering some kind of coupon or free item, they are trying to upsell everyone in line an apple pie. ξNo clue of concept about how to take care of or treat customers. ξIn short will not return to this McDonalds. ξAvoid at all costs.

Went here after work for a quick Mickey D fix. I had order a 6 piece chicken nuggets meal. Sorry to say but I think it will be my last time here. Don't get me wrong, the food tasted fine by my insides didn't think so.

This might be the worst McDonald's that exists. Make sure you check your order because there is a 97.2% chance it's incorrect. Also be careful if you're coming here at night...the neighborhood is super sketch.
This McDonalds. We hate going to this one because no matter what time of the day we go, they always mess up our orders. We have a big family, and every time, there are a few things always missing.

At first, this McDonald's location was an angel because even though breakfast was over, they had some leftover and were able to fulfill our orders.But, that was it.The cashier who was the manger was oh so....unfriendly. ξNot even a smile. ξIt was like "what do you want?" ξIt wasn't just with me and my party but towards other customers. ξLike gee, did you get up from the wrong side of the bed or what?Then, my fiance dumped his sweet tea as it was bitter.A friend of mine dumped his coffee as it was horrible.Friendly service and fresh beverage would have definitely saved this place.

Ok, so I arrive here with a coupon that says 'order 1 extra value meal and get a like sandwich. ξKey word...'like'. ξMy options for my meal included either 1 big mac or 2 cheeseburgers. ξI order 2 cheeseburgers. ξThen for my sandwich I request 2 additional cheeseburgers. ξThe manager tells me 'no, I can only get 1, not 2. ξDuhhh...I said "why do u think 'like' is emphasized in the wording"??? ξAgain she said, I can only get 1 sandwich, not 2. ξFine. ξOf course, then I looked for the biggest sandwich I could find....the Bacon Angus Cheeseburger which I think may cost more than the value meal alone and quite frankly probably shouldn't be honored since it wasn't a part of the deal to begin with. ξOh well.....On top of that I'm still callin' corporate to complain.....I'm entitled to my 2 cheeseburgers.

The worst service I've ever seen! They act like you're bothering them. I'll drive an extra couple of miles to go to another McDonald's. or just go somewhere else.

I'd say from late last night possibly but certainly not brewed this morning. We should have went to the coffee shop next door. Avoid the drive through in the evenings.Food takes too long, the people taking orders and at the window are not professional at all.If I do plan on going to this McDonalds at night, I always have a better experience walking in.

Pulling up to the drive through and asking a question about a new sandwich prompted a rude and uneducated answer from the female cashier. Filthy store. ξAttitude-ridden employees. ξAlways out of whatever you order. ξCan't get your order correct without having to repeat it about twenty times.The most enjoyable thing I've experience here was watching a cockroach and an ant race toward the wood paneling as I waited for a friend to repeat her order for the 40th time.Yeah. ξCouldn't be drunk enough to try this location again.

This is hands down the WORST McD's location.I keep saying I wont go back but I think what keeps me going back is that living in the heart of Summerlin there isn't much of an option besides the Burger King on Town Center.The drive-thru is always so so so long and the workers at the window are so slow and seem like it is their first day every time. one of the most horrible mikey ds ive ever visited. connected to the chevron. ξthey are always out of something. ξfries are never hot. ξmanagement is not friendly. ξredbox outside has scracted dvds. ξUSELESS! ξnuff said.

Sometimes you need to let loose...Just don't do it here. ξDrive thru service is completely horrible. The only thing I'm going to write about it is the location itself and the service. ξThis location is great if you work nearby (so you dont have to park behind the building), and there is a lot of seating. WOW. Have you ever wondered what it would be like to eat at the cafeteria of an insane asylum? ξJust come to this lovely eatery for a meal and your wish will be granted. ξThere are more derelict and eccentric clientele at this McDonald's location than in the rest of downtown Chicago - in fact, this might be their home base. ξTo be honest, I am stumped as to how this place continues to operate. ξThey just let the crazies run amok inside, screaming obscenities and rambling on about who knows what. ξTo get a taste just walk by, there is generally a decent collection of nut-jobs outside as well.I wonder how many people have died in this McDonald's?

This particular location has by far the worst service overall. I am not lying when I say that 7 out of 10 visits whether it be drive-thru or walk-in, something is wrong with my order. I can remember my order for extra onions on McRib sandwiches or hamburgers have been produced with extra pickles and no onions. A recent visit took 25 minutes to produce a 10 piece chicken mcnuggets and a soda. I've worked at a McDonald's before, and if I had a valid food card, and ambassadorial privileges, I could have changed the oil, re-heat the fryer, located a box in their freezer, and fry my own food, and still get to school on time. The shift manager gave me a large fries and 2 cups for drinks, not being sensitive to the fact that I had diabetes, and I had ordered nuggets for speedy service and avoidance of excess carbs.The service today was not as bad, but why do they go through the trouble of asking what kind of sauce do I want with my nuggets if they aren't going to give it to me?
